review: Azaz's fertile lands near Aleppo are perfect for olive and wheat farming, combining tradition with logistics potential near Turkey.
The proximity to Azaz’s trade routes makes this land highly suitable for export-oriented agriculture.
Talkalakh in Homs boasts moderate climate and rich soil, ideal for vegetables and grains.
This land offers a great opportunity for irrigation-based farming with excellent productivity near Talkalakh.
Maaret Tamsrin’s lands are known for pistachios and olives — a smart investment in Idlib countryside.
Traditional farming expertise and favorable soil conditions make Idlib’s farms near Maaret Tamsrin reliable for agriculture.
Tell Abyad offers excellent potential for irrigated farming and seasonal crops thanks to its Euphrates access.
Raqqa’s countryside near Tell Abyad is reviving rapidly, providing fertile and affordable farmland.
Bosra’s lands in Daraa are ideal for wheat and barley, with access to Jordanian markets nearby.
This strategic location near Bosra makes agricultural exports more accessible and profitable.
Masyaf’s green plains are excellent for sunflowers and seasonal crops, thanks to reliable irrigation.
The surrounding infrastructure near Masyaf helps streamline logistics for agricultural production.
Baniyas in Tartus has a mild coastal climate ideal for citrus orchards and eco-agriculture.
Access to Tartus port makes export of fruits and herbs from Baniyas easier and more profitable.
Jableh's coastline provides tourism and farming fusion opportunities, especially for citrus and greenhouse vegetables.
The land near Jableh is fertile and well-connected, ideal for both agriculture and tourism ventures.
Al Mayadin's access to the Euphrates supports productive farming with large-scale irrigation.
Deir ez-Zor lands near Al Mayadin are ideal for rice, wheat, and vegetables with strong water access.
Al-Qadam near Damascus is an ideal spot for orchard farming, with stable water access and climate.
The close proximity to Damascus markets offers fast distribution for fresh produce from Al-Qadam.
